definitions.definition: ( transitive or intransitive ) To look at and interpret letters or other information that is written .

subdefinitions.definition: ( ergative , of text ) To be understood or physically read in a specific way.
( transitive , metonymic ) To read a work or works written by the named author .
examples: At the moment I'm reading Milton.

definitions.definition: ( transitive or intransitive ) To speak aloud words or other information that is written. ( often construed with a to phrase or an indirect object )
examples: He read us a passage from his new book.
All right, class, who wants to read next?

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To interpret , or infer a meaning , significance , thought , intention , etc., from.
examples: She read my mind and promptly rose to get me a glass of water.
I can read his feelings in his face.
On the door hung a sign that read "No admittance".

definitions.definition: ( ergative ) To substitute a corrected piece of text in place of an erroneous one; used to introduce an emendation of a text .

subdefinitions.definition: ( by extension , ironic or humorous , usually imperative ) Used to introduce a blunter, actually intended meaning .
examples: Our school focuses primarily on the liberal arts ( read "useless degrees").

definitions.definition: ( transitive , telecommunications ) To be able to hear what another person is saying over a radio connection.
( transitive , rail transport ) To observe and comprehend (a displayed signal ).
examples: A repeater signal may be used where the track geometry makes the main signal difficult to read from a distance.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , Commonwealth , except Scotland ) To study (a subject) at a high level, especially at university .
examples: I am reading theology at university.

definitions.definition: ( computing , transitive ) To fetch data from (a storage medium, etc. ).
( transitive , LGBTQ ) To recognise (someone) as being transgender .
examples: Every time I go outside, I worry that someone will read me.

definitions.definition: ( at first especially in the black LGBTQ community ) To call attention to the flaws of (someone) in a playful , taunting , or insulting way.
( go ) To imagine sequences of potential moves and responses without actually placing stones .
( obsolete ) To think , believe ; to consider (that).
( obsolete ) To advise ; to counsel. See rede .
( obsolete ) To tell; to declare ; to recite .
